deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@title LootBoxRandomness
 LootBoxRandomness- support for a randomized and openable lootbox.
@dev Set up the fields of the state that should have initial values.

@dev If the tokens for some class are pre-minted and owned by the
 contract owner, they can be used for a given class by setting them here

@dev Alternate way to add token ids to a class
 Note: resets the full list for the class instead of adding each token id

@dev Remove all token ids for a given class, causing it to fall back to
 creating/minting into the nft address

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct LootBoxRandomness.LootBoxRandomnessState storage pointer,uint16[] memory) returns (uint256)

documentation.text:
@dev Main minting logic for lootboxes
 This is called via safeTransferFrom when CreatureAccessoryLootBox extends
 CreatureAccessoryFactory.
 NOTE: prices and fees are determined by the sell order on OpenSea.
 WARNING: Make sure msg.sender can mint!

@dev Pseudo-random number generator
 NOTE: to improve randomness, generate it with an oracle

@title LootBoxRandomness
 LootBoxRandomness- support for a randomized and openable lootbox.
@dev Set up the fields of the state that should have initial values.

@dev If the tokens for some class are pre-minted and owned by the
 contract owner, they can be used for a given class by setting them here

@dev Alternate way to add token ids to a class
 Note: resets the full list for the class instead of adding each token id

@dev Remove all token ids for a given class, causing it to fall back to
 creating/minting into the nft address

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct LootBoxRandomness.LootBoxRandomnessState storage pointer,uint16[] memory) returns (uint256)

documentation.text:
@dev Main minting logic for lootboxes
 This is called via safeTransferFrom when CreatureAccessoryLootBox extends
 CreatureAccessoryFactory.
 NOTE: prices and fees are determined by the sell order on OpenSea.
 WARNING: Make sure msg.sender can mint!

@dev Pseudo-random number generator
 NOTE: to improve randomness, generate it with an oracle

initState(LootBoxRandomness.LootBoxRando.details: Set up the fields of the state that should have initial values.

resetClass(LootBoxRandomness.LootBoxRand.details: Remove all token ids for a given class, causing it to fall back to creating/minting into the nft address

setClassForTokenId(LootBoxRandomness.Loo.details: If the tokens for some class are pre-minted and owned by the contract owner, they can be used for a given class by setting them here

setOptionSettings(LootBoxRandomness.Loot.details: Set the settings for a particular lootbox option

params._classProbabilities: Array of probabilities (basis points, so integers out of 10,000)                            of receiving each class (the index in the array).                            Should add up to 10k and be descending in value.
params._guarantees: Array of the number of guaranteed items received for each class                            (the index in the array).
params._maxQuantityPerOpen: Maximum number of items to mint per open.                            Set to 0 to disable this option.
params._option: The Option to set settings for

setSeed(LootBoxRandomness.LootBoxRandomn.details: Improve pseudorandom number generator by letting the owner set the seed manually, making attacks more difficult

params._newSeed: The new seed to use for the next transaction

setTokenIdsForClass(LootBoxRandomness.Lo.details: Alternate way to add token ids to a class Note: resets the full list for the class instead of adding each token id

devdoc.title: LootBoxRandomness LootBoxRandomness- support for a randomized and openable lootbox.
